perturbation.original_text: Pursuant and subject to Rule 13d-1(k)(1) promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby agree to the joint filing of the Statement on Schedule 13D to which this Joint Filing Agreement is attached, and any amendments thereto may be filed without the necessity of filing additional joint filing agreements. This Joint Filing Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument.
perturbation.changed_text: Pursuant and subject to Rule 13d-1(k)(1) promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby agree to the joint filing of the Statement on Schedule 13D to which this Joint Filing Agreement is attached. Amendments thereto must be filed with new joint filing agreements for each instance. This Joint Filing Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that amendments can be filed without additional joint filing agreements, while the modified text mandates a new agreement for each amendment. This creates uncertainty about the filing requirements.

perturbation.original_text: The execution and filing of this agreement shall not be construed as an admission that the below-named parties are a group or have acted as a group.
perturbation.changed_text: The execution and filing of this agreement shall be construed as an admission that the below-named parties are potentially a group or have acted as a group.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly denies that the agreement implies the parties are a group. The modified text directly contradicts this by stating that it implies they are 'potentially' a group. This introduces ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: This Joint Filing Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument.
perturbation.changed_text: This Joint Filing Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts. Some counterparts shall be deemed an original, but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that each counterpart is an original, providing clarity on the legal validity of each copy. The modified version introduces ambiguity by stating only 'some' counterparts are original, creating confusion about which documents are legally binding.
